conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles to predict which container it will flow into.
A, B, C, and D are the points where the liquid enters the system.
The colors of the baffles are: A is green, B is yellow, C is orange, D is pink.
Liquid from A flows into the green baffle and is directed into container E.
Liquid from B flows into the yellow baffle and is directed into container F.
Liquid from C flows into the orange baffle and is directed into container G.
Liquid from D flows into the pink baffle and is directed into container H.
In the first image, the liquid from A, B, C, and D is shown entering the system.
In the second image, the liquid is shown flowing through the baffles and starting to enter the containers.
In the third image, the liquid is shown fully entering the containers E, F, G, and H respectively.
The liquid from A flows into container E.
The liquid from B flows into container F.
The liquid from C flows into container G.
The liquid from D flows into container H.
Final answer: A flows into E, B flows into F, C flows into G, D flows into H.
